name: rabbitMQInbound
title: RabbitMq
help: Configures a RabbitMQ listener to consume messages from a specified queue and inject them into a sequence.

value.name: name
value.helpTip: A unique name for this RabbitMQ Inbound Endpoint configuration.

value.name: sequence
value.helpTip: The name of the **mediation sequence** that will process the consumed RabbitMQ messages.

value.name: onError
value.helpTip: The name of the **error handling sequence** to execute if an error occurs during message consumption or processing.

value.name: inbound.behavior
value.helpTip: Defines the message consumption mode (e.g., event-based for immediate processing).

value.name: sequential
value.helpTip: If enabled, messages will be processed one after the other within the injection sequence, preserving message order.

value.name: coordination
value.helpTip: In a clustered environment, set this to true to ensure that only a **single worker node** is consuming messages from the queue at any given time.

value.name: rabbitmq.server.host.name
value.helpTip: Enter RabbitMQ server Hostnames as a comma-separated list (e.g., host1,host2).

value.name: rabbitmq.server.port
value.helpTip: Enter RabbitMQ server ports as a comma-separated list (e.g., port1,port2). Default is 5672 for non-SSL.

value.name: rabbitmq.queue.name
value.helpTip: The name of the RabbitMQ queue to consume messages from.

value.name: rabbitmq.queue.type
value.helpTip: Queue type to interact with: **CLASSIC**, **QUORUM** (high availability), or **STREAM** (large, continuous flow).

value.name: rabbitmq.queue.auto.declare
value.helpTip: If enabled, the inbound endpoint will attempt to declare the queue if it doesn't exist.

value.name: rabbitmq.exchange.name
value.helpTip: Name of the exchange to bind the queue to. Leave empty to consume directly from the queue.

value.name: rabbitmq.exchange.type
value.helpTip: Type of the exchange: **DIRECT**, **FANOUT**, **TOPIC**, or **HEADERS**.

value.name: rabbitmq.exchange.auto.declare
value.helpTip: If enabled, the inbound endpoint will attempt to declare the exchange if it doesn't exist.

value.name: rabbitmq.routing.key
value.helpTip: Routing key for binding the queue to a **DIRECT** or **TOPIC** exchange. Queue name is used if omitted.

value.name: rabbitmq.connection.sasl.mechanism
value.helpTip: Select the SASL mechanism for connection authentication.

value.name: rabbitmq.connection.oauth2.enabled
value.helpTip: Enable OAuth 2.0 (e.g., Client Credentials or Password Grant) for authentication.

value.name: rabbitmq.server.user.name
value.helpTip: Username for PLAIN authentication.

value.name: rabbitmq.server.password
value.helpTip: Password for PLAIN authentication.

value.name: rabbitmq.connection.oauth2.token.endpoint
value.helpTip: The OAuth 2.0 token endpoint URL to retrieve the access token.

value.name: rabbitmq.connection.oauth2.grant.type
value.helpTip: The OAuth 2.0 grant type to use for token retrieval.

value.name: rabbitmq.connection.oauth2.client.id
value.helpTip: The client ID for OAuth 2.0 authentication.

value.name: rabbitmq.connection.oauth2.client.secret
value.helpTip: The client secret for OAuth 2.0 authentication.

value.name: rabbitmq.connection.oauth2.username
value.helpTip: Username required when using the **password** OAuth 2.0 grant type.

value.name: rabbitmq.connection.oauth2.password
value.helpTip: Password required when using the **password** OAuth 2.0 grant type.

value.name: rabbitmq.connection.idle.timeout
value.helpTip: Maximum period (in milliseconds) the connection can remain idle before being closed.

value.name: rabbitmq.connection.establish.retry.count
value.helpTip: Number of times to retry establishing the connection. Leave blank for default.

value.name: rabbitmq.connection.establish.retry.interval
value.helpTip: Interval (in milliseconds) between retries when establishing the connection.

value.name: rabbitmq.connection.recovery.policy.type
value.helpTip: Defines the strategy for automatic connection recovery after a disconnection.

value.name: rabbitmq.connection.recovery.initial.delay
value.helpTip: Initial delay (in milliseconds) before the first recovery attempt starts.

value.name: rabbitmq.connection.recovery.retry.interval
value.helpTip: Fixed interval (in milliseconds) between connection recovery retries.

value.name: rabbitmq.connection.recovery.retry.timeout
value.helpTip: Total time (in milliseconds) allowed for the connection recovery process before giving up.

value.name: rabbitmq.queue.arguments
value.helpTip: Additional arguments (comma-separated key=value) to use when declaring the queue.

value.name: rabbitmq.classic.version
value.helpTip: For Classic Queues: select the queue version (V1 or V2). V2 offers better performance.

value.name: rabbitmq.classic.dead.letter.strategy
value.helpTip: Strategy for failed messages: retry and discard, or discard immediately.

value.name: rabbitmq.classic.max.priority
value.helpTip: For Classic Queues: the maximum priority level the queue should support (0-255).

value.name: rabbitmq.quorum.initial.member.count
value.helpTip: For Quorum Queues: the initial number of replica nodes required.

value.name: rabbitmq.quorum.delivery.limit
value.helpTip: For Quorum Queues: maximum times a message can be redelivered before dead-lettering.

value.name: rabbitmq.quorum.dead.letter.strategy
value.helpTip: For Quorum Queues: defines the acknowledgment and redelivery behavior for failed messages.

value.name: rabbitmq.stream.initial.member.count
value.helpTip: For STREAM queues: the initial number of stream members. Leave blank for default.

value.name: rabbitmq.stream.max.age
value.helpTip: For STREAM queues: maximum retention time for stream data (e.g., '300').

value.name: rabbitmq.stream.max.segment.size
value.helpTip: For STREAM queues: maximum size (in bytes) of a single segment file.

value.name: rabbitmq.queue.exclusive
value.helpTip: If enabled, the queue is deleted when the declaring connection closes. Only one consumer can use it.

value.name: rabbitmq.queue.auto.delete
value.helpTip: If enabled, the queue is deleted when the last consumer disconnects.

value.name: rabbitmq.header.exchange.binding.arguments
value.helpTip: For **HEADERS** exchanges: set binding headers (e.g., `x-match=any`).

value.name: rabbitmq.exchange.arguments
value.helpTip: Additional arguments (comma-separated key=value) to use when declaring the exchange.

value.name: rabbitmq.exchange.auto.delete
value.helpTip: If enabled, the exchange is deleted when the last queue is unbound.

value.name: rabbitmq.stream.filters
value.helpTip: For STREAM queues: filters (comma-separated values) to apply when consuming messages. Only matching messages are consumed.

value.name: rabbitmq.stream.filter.match.unfiltered
value.helpTip: If checked, messages without a filter value will also be consumed.

value.name: rabbitmq.stream.offset.starting.value
value.helpTip: Message consumption starts from this specific offset value (e.g., message position). This value overrides the Offset Strategy.

value.name: rabbitmq.stream.offset.starting.strategy
value.helpTip: Where consumption starts: **FIRST**, **LAST**, or **NEXT** (for new chunks).

value.name: rabbitmq.stream.offset.tracker.flush.interval
value.helpTip: Frequency (in seconds) to persist the consumer's current offset.

value.name: rabbitmq.stream.offset.tracker.shutdown.timeout
value.helpTip: Time (in seconds) to wait for the offset tracker to safely flush state on shutdown.

value.name: rabbitmq.connection.ssl.enabled
value.helpTip: Enable SSL/TLS for the RabbitMQ connection.

value.name: rabbitmq.connection.ssl.trust.everything
value.helpTip: If enabled, all server certificates are accepted. **Not recommended for production.**

value.name: rabbitmq.connection.ssl.keystore.location
value.helpTip: File path to the Keystore containing the client's private key and certificate.

value.name: rabbitmq.connection.ssl.keystore.type
value.helpTip: The type of the Keystore (e.g., JKS).

value.name: rabbitmq.connection.ssl.keystore.password
value.helpTip: The password to access the Keystore.

value.name: rabbitmq.connection.ssl.truststore.location
value.helpTip: File path to the Truststore containing trusted server certificates.

value.name: rabbitmq.connection.ssl.truststore.type
value.helpTip: The type of the Truststore (e.g., JKS).

value.name: rabbitmq.connection.ssl.truststore.password
value.helpTip: The password to access the Truststore.

value.name: rabbitmq.connection.ssl.version
value.helpTip: The preferred SSL/TLS protocol version (e.g., 'TLSv1.2', 'TLSv1.3').

value.name: rabbitmq.connection.ssl.hostname.verification.enabled
value.helpTip: If enabled, verifies the hostname in the server's certificate against the connected host name.

value.name: rabbitmq.dead.letter.queue.name
value.helpTip: The name of the Dead Letter Queue (DLQ) for failed messages.

value.name: rabbitmq.dead.letter.queue.type
value.helpTip: The type of the Dead Letter Queue.

value.name: rabbitmq.dead.letter.queue.auto.declare
value.helpTip: If enabled, the inbound endpoint will attempt to declare the Dead Letter Queue.

value.name: rabbitmq.dead.letter.exchange.name
value.helpTip: The name of the Dead Letter Exchange (DLX) to route dead-lettered messages.

value.name: rabbitmq.dead.letter.exchange.type
value.helpTip: The type of the Dead Letter Exchange.

value.name: rabbitmq.dead.letter.exchange.auto.declare
value.helpTip: If enabled, the inbound endpoint will attempt to declare the Dead Letter Exchange.

value.name: rabbitmq.dead.letter.routing.key
value.helpTip: The routing key for messages sent to the Dead Letter Exchange (for DIRECT DLXs only).

value.name: rabbitmq.max.dead.lettered.count
value.helpTip: Maximum times a message can be dead-lettered and retried before being sent to the final DLQ.

value.name: rabbitmq.final.dead.letter.queue.name
value.helpTip: The name of the final DLQ for messages that exceed the Max Dead Lettered Count.

value.name: rabbitmq.final.dead.letter.queue.type
value.helpTip: The type of the final Dead Letter Queue.

value.name: rabbitmq.final.dead.letter.queue.auto.declare
value.displayName: Final Dead Letter Queue Auto declare
value.helpTip: If enabled, the inbound endpoint will attempt to declare the final Dead Letter Queue.

value.name: rabbitmq.final.dead.letter.exchange.name
value.helpTip: The name of the final Dead Letter Exchange to route messages exceeding retry limits.

value.name: rabbitmq.final.dead.letter.exchange.type
value.helpTip: The type of the final Dead Letter Exchange.

value.name: rabbitmq.final.dead.letter.exchange.auto.declare
value.displayName: Final Dead Letter Exchange Auto declare
value.helpTip: If enabled, the inbound endpoint will attempt to declare the final Dead Letter Exchange.

value.name: rabbitmq.final.dead.letter.routing.key
value.helpTip: The routing key for messages sent to the final Dead Letter Exchange (for DIRECT DLXs only).

value.name: rabbitmq.dead.letter.publisher.retry.interval
value.helpTip: Interval (in milliseconds) between retries when publishing to a Dead Letter Queue.

value.name: rabbitmq.dead.letter.publisher.retry.count
value.helpTip: Number of times to retry publishing a message to a Dead Letter Queue.

value.name: rabbitmq.dead.letter.publisher.retry.exponential.factor
value.displayName: Dead Letter Publisher Retry Exponential Factor
value.helpTip: Exponential backoff factor applied to the retry interval (e.g., 2.0 doubles the interval).

value.name: rabbitmq.dead.letter.publisher.ack.wait.time
value.displayName: Dead Letter Publisher Broker ACKNOWLEDGE Waiting Time (ms)
value.helpTip: Maximum time (in milliseconds) to wait for the broker to acknowledge a dead-letter message.

value.name: rabbitmq.dead.letter.publisher.shutdown.timeout
value.helpTip: Time (in milliseconds) to wait for the dead letter publisher to shut down gracefully.

value.name: rabbitmq.throttle.enabled
value.helpTip: If enabled, message consumption will be throttled to a specified rate.

value.name: rabbitmq.throttle.mode
value.helpTip: Mode of throttling: **FIXED_INTERVAL** or **BATCH**.

value.name: rabbitmq.throttle.timeUnit
value.helpTip: The time unit for the throttling rate: per **MINUTE**, **HOUR**, or **DAY**.

value.name: rabbitmq.throttle.count
value.helpTip: Maximum number of messages to consume within the specified time unit.

value.name: rabbitmq.server.virtual.host
value.helpTip: The virtual host (vhost) to connect to. Leave blank for the default '/' vhost.

value.name: rabbitmq.message.content.type
value.helpTip: The Content-Type header to set for the consumed message.

value.name: rabbitmq.queue.overflow.strategy
value.helpTip: What happens when queue is full: **DROP_HEAD** (oldest discarded), **REJECT_PUBLISH**, or **REJECT_PUBLISH_DLX**.

value.name: rabbitmq.message.requeue.delay
value.helpTip: Delay (in milliseconds) before a failed message is automatically requeued.

value.name: rabbitmq.auto.ack.enabled
value.helpTip: If enabled, messages are automatically acknowledged (ACKed) upon receipt.

value.name: rabbitmq.ack.wait.time
value.helpTip: Maximum time (in milliseconds) to wait for a message acknowledgment (ACK).

value.name: rabbitmq.concurrent.consumers.count
value.helpTip: The number of concurrent consumers to create for processing messages.

value.name: rabbitmq.message.receiver.thread.pool.size
value.helpTip: Size of the thread pool for receiving messages. Recommended to be greater than the number of concurrent consumers.

value.name: rabbitmq.consumer.initial.credit
value.helpTip: The prefetch count, limiting unacknowledged messages sent to the consumer (QoS).

value.name: rabbitmq.classic.override.requeue.with.discard
value.helpTip: For Classic Queues: if enabled, any requeue attempt for a failed message will result in discard instead.
